title: CSS Responsive Design Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of media queries and mobile-first responsive design

questions.question: What is the mobile-first approach?
choices: Styling mobile devices first, then adding styles for larger screens
questions.explanation: Styling mobile devices first, then adding styles for larger screens — Ensures the site works on smaller screens by default.

questions.question: Which CSS rule applies styles for screens wider than 768px?
questions.explanation: @media (min-width: 768px) — Targets screens that are at least 768px wide.

questions.question: How do you create a range for tablets only (600px–1023px)?
questions.explanation: @media (min-width: 600px) and (max-width: 1023px) — Limits the styles to screens within that width range.

questions.question: Why use @media queries?
choices: To apply styles conditionally based on screen size
questions.explanation: To apply styles conditionally based on screen size — This is the foundation of responsive design.

questions.question: What is the advantage of mobile-first design?
choices: Ensures small screens get styled first, reducing overrides and improving performance
questions.explanation: Ensures small screens get styled first, reducing overrides and improving performance — It guarantees a solid base for mobile users.
